messages.content:
You are a Google Drive data generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to generate realistic Drive file data based on scenario information.

The output must be valid JSON matching the Drive schema with:
- files: array of {id, name, mimeType (optional), content (optional text excerpt), modifiedTime (optional)}

Generate Drive files that reflect:
- Events from sub_scenarios_expanded (core scenario events, e.g., documents, reports)
- Events from noise_scenarios (unrelated workplace files)
- Respect noise_level: 0 = minimal noise, 1 = lots of unrelated files
- Respect depth: 0 = direct/obvious files, 1 = indirect/multi-step file references

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

      "content": "Folder referenced by Sam in Slack: contains the latest analytics dump for the week of 2025-11-03."
    },
    {
      "id": "drive_MOB_planning_agenda_v1",
      "name": "MOB Planning - Feature scope & performance targets (Draft Agenda)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-07T10:50:00-05:00",
      "content": "MOB Planning: Feature scope & performance targets

Context: Initial planning sync for Mobile App Launch (MOB) to review feature scope, performance targets, and rollout milestones.

Original calendar placeholder
- Title: "MOB Planning: Feature scope & performance targets"
- Organizer: alex.smith@company.com
- Tentative date: Tue Nov 11, 2025, 11:00–12:00 ET (later cancelled and rescheduled)

Attendees
- Alex Smith (PM, R&D)
- Jordan Johnson (Engineer, Engineering)
- Sam Williams (Senior Engineer, R&D)

Initial Agenda (60 min)
1. Review MOB-100 completion
2. MOB-101 implementation plan
3. Draft performance targets

Notes
- Meeting will likely need to move if engineering conflicts arise (e.g., infra review). Duration may be shortened to ~45 minutes depending on schedules."
    },
    {
      "id": "drive_MOB_planning_reschedule_notes",
      "name": "MOB Planning Reschedule - Coordination Notes",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-08T15:15:00-05:00",
      "content": "MOB Planning – Reschedule Coordination Notes
Author: Alex Smith
Date: 2025-11-08

Background
- Original event: "MOB Planning: Feature scope & performance targets" on Tue Nov 11, 2025, 11:00–12:00 ET.
- Event ID: cal_MOB_planning_20251111T160000Z (now cancelled).
- Conflict: Jordan required for infra review Tue 11–12 (per Taylor on Slack).

Inputs
1) Slack DM with Taylor (2025-11-08 10:32 ET)
   - Taylor confirmed infra review locked for Tue 11–12.
   - Asked if "MOB Planning" can move.
   - I (Alex) agreed to reshuffle later in the week and update invite.

2) Slack DM with Jordan (2025-11-08 14:10 ET)
   - Jordan’s availability:
     * Wed: usually 10–11 free, Wed afternoon busy except some pockets.
     * Thu: 14:00–17:00 mostly open.
     * Avoid daily standup at 13:30.

3) Email exchange with Sam (2025-11-08 ~14:28–14:55 ET)
   - I proposed moving to later in the week; target duration: 45 minutes.
   - From Sam’s calendar: mostly free Wed afternoon except 14:00–14:30; Thu morning open.
   - Sam’s constraints:
     * Wed afternoon OK if done by 15:30.
     * Ad-hoc QA sync ~16:00, not on calendar.
     * Prefers Wednesday to keep decisions this week.

Constraint summary
- Duration: 45 minutes (not full 60).
- Time window: next week working hours; ideally midweek.
- Hard constraints:
  * Avoid Tue 11–12 (infra review).
  * Avoid Wed 13:30 standup (Jordan).
  * Avoid Wed after ~15:30 (Sam preference) and ~16:00 QA sync.
- Preferences:
  * Sam prefers Wednesday over Thursday.

Candidate slots considered
- Wed 10:00–10:45 ET
  * Pros: Fits Jordan’s Wed 10–11.
  * Cons: Conflicts with Alex’s morning sync (per calendar check).

- Wed 14:00–14:45 ET
  * Pros:
    - Within Sam’s Wed afternoon window and finishes by 15:30.
    - Avoids Jordan’s 13:30 standup.
    - Leaves buffer before Sam’s ad-hoc QA around 16:00.
  * Cons: Requires shortening from original 60 to 45 minutes (acceptable based on email thread).

- Thu 14:00–14:45 ET
  * Pros: Jordan’s Thu 14:00–17:00 availability.
  * Cons: Sam prefers Wed; would delay decisions.

Decision
- Final pick: Wed, Nov 13, 2025 – 14:00–14:45 ET.
- Event details:
  * Title: "MOB Planning: Feature scope & performance targets (rescheduled)".
  * Duration: 45 minutes.
  * Location: Google Meet.
  * Attendees: Alex Smith (PM), Jordan Johnson (Engineering), Sam Williams (R&D).

Next steps
- Update calendar invite to new slot (done via Google Calendar).
- Ensure agenda in "MOB Planning – Feature scope & performance targets (Draft Agenda)" is trimmed to fit 45 minutes."
    },

    },
    {
      "id": "drive_MOB_weekly_wins_draft",
      "name": "[MOB] Weekly Wins – Week of Nov 3 (Draft)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-08T16:45:00-05:00",
      "content": "DRAFT – DO NOT SEND

[MOB] Weekly Wins – Week of Nov 3
Author: Alex Smith
Timeframe: 2025-11-03 to 2025-11-09

Source references
- Jira comment on MOB-101 (2025-11-06 10:15 ET) from Jordan:
  * Image caching layer rolled out to 25% of beta users.
  * 14–16% reduction in median app start time.
  * ~12% reduction in p95 feed load.
- Analytics export: analytics_MOB_weekly_2025W45 (generated 2025-11-08 09:30 ET):
  * Active users previous period: 20,000
  * Active users current period: 22,050
  * Active users growth: 10.25%
  * Avg app start time improvement: 15.0%
- Slack DM from Sam (2025-11-08 09:35 ET):
  * "~15% faster app start and just over 10% weekly active user growth after the promo campaign."

Draft email body

Team,

Some quick highlights from this week on Mobile:

1) Performance improvements
- With the new image caching rollout, we’re now seeing roughly a 15% reduction in average app start time and double-digit drops in tail latency.
- Early beta results look stable; we’ll continue to expand the rollout next week.

2) User growth
- Between the performance work and the omnichannel promo, weekly active users are up ~10% week over week.
- Early retention numbers for the new cohort also look promising (details in the dashboard).

3) Launch readiness
- MOB-100 (Initial Setup) is fully wrapped.
- MOB-101 (Core Feature) is in progress and tracking on the updated timeline.

I’ll polish this and send it to the broader list later today.

– Alex

Checklist before sending
- [x] Validate performance numbers against analytics export (15% improvement).
- [x] Round user growth to ~10% for easier communication.
- [x] Confirm MOB-101 status is still "In Progress" in Jira.
- [ ] Add note about using next week’s planning session to lock remaining work."
    },
    {
      "id": "drive_MOB_weekly_wins_final",
      "name": "[MOB] Weekly Wins – Week of Nov 3",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-08T18:05:00-05:00",
      "content": "[MOB] Weekly Wins – Week of Nov 3
Author: Alex Smith (PM, Mobile App Launch)
Sent via email: 2025-11-08T18:02:00-05:00
Distribution: rnd-team@company.com, eng-leads@company.com; cc: product-leadership@company.com

Final email content

Hi all,

Sharing a quick snapshot of this week’s wins on Mobile:

1) Performance improvements
- Thanks to the new image caching layer and a few networking tweaks, we’re seeing about a 15% improvement in average app start time across the monitored cohort.
- In addition to the faster start, p95 feed load times are down noticeably, which should translate to a smoother first-use experience.

2) User growth
- Weekly active users on the mobile app are up roughly 10% week over week.
- A combination of the performance work and the Nov promo campaign seems to be driving better engagement, especially on first and second sessions.

3) Launch readiness
- MOB-100 (Mobile App Launch – Initial Setup) is complete.
- MOB-101 (Mobile App Launch – Core Feature) is in progress and on track for the current milestone.

We’ll use next week’s planning session to lock in the remaining work needed for the November 30 launch.

Thanks everyone for the push this week.

Alex
PM, Mobile App Launch

Appendix – Metric details
- Performance improvement percent (avg app start time): 15%
- Weekly active users growth: ~10% (from 20,000 to 22,050, per analytics_MOB_weekly_2025W45)."
    },
